title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
to God of War: Ragnarok Dev. Team,

I’m writing to bring to your attention an issue regarding the current PC port of God of War: Ragnarok that affects users with 4GB VRAM graphics cards. When attempting to launch the game on such systems, an error message is displayed, indicating that there is not enough VRAM, and the game closes without allowing users to proceed. It is my humble request to kindly reconsider or remove this VRAM limitation. From personal experience and community feedback, I can confirm that the game runs well on certain integrated graphics processors (such as the Ryzen 3 3200G, Ryzen 5 3400G, and Ryzen 7 5700G), which are generally weaker than many 4GB VRAM GPUs available today. God of War: Ragnarok performs on the base PlayStation 4, which further suggests that the game should be capable of running on 4GB VRAM graphics cards, and the latest Steam Hardware Survey shows that one of the most widely used graphics cards among gamers is the GTX 1650, which comes with 4GB of VRAM and is ranked within the top three most popular cards. Limiting access to such a significant portion of the player base can potentially prevent many from enjoying your incredible game. Removing or adjusting this VRAM limitation would greatly benefit the gaming community, ensuring that a larger audience can experience God of War: Ragnarok on PC!

EDIT : there’s a workaround and you can bypass this VRAM limit error by using a mod. ( MOD LINK : https://www.nexusmods.com/godofwarragnarok/mods/12?tab=files ) To install it, just drag and drop the files into the game's root folder, and the game should launch without any issues. It's unclear why Jetpack Interactive locked out 4GB VRAM cards, especially since the game runs just fine on them!

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Creating a PSN account was something I knew was necessary in advance and I was prepared to do so, until I was met with the reality of it. 

For UK residents at least, it requires submitting a mobile phone number to verify your age just to start with, and if that fails (which it did, no texts were ever received) your only recourse is to submit a photograph of your face or a government-issued ID to a third party website.

If you're happy with that, go right ahead.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Played it on PS4pro, which almost melted every time I played it in 30FPS.
Played it on PS5, which made me chose between 30FPS fidelity and 60FPS 2k blurfest*.
Playing it on PC right now, looks twice as good, 4k, everything ultra, full DLAA, still 60-90 FPS. 
Now I'm happy.
Thank you, SONY
NOW
GIVE
ME
BLOODBORNE
ON
PC

Pretty please

*OK, have to clarify since I got a ton of angry comments below the review. 
(Oh boy, that will teach me not to tick the "allow comments" ever again.)
PS5 1440p mode looks fine on my TV and it looks fine on my 2k monitor. 1440p does NOT look fine on a monitor with a native 5120x2880 resolution, which is my primary.

Regarding PSN:
Complaints come from people with a steam account, a paypal account, an apple or Samsung phone, and 5 different social media accounts. All of your online behaviour is tracked anyways. Deal with it and adapt. In case you need to snort coca**n out of a lad*b**s b*ttcr**ck, use VPN and always pay cash.
Update: Nexusmod got a 1.6MB file that gets rid of PSN completely.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
So the developers clearly never tested the game at resolutions other than 4K. At 1440p the text and icon scaling makes all UI elements look terrible. I had to resort to running the game at 4K via Dynamic Super Resolution to fix this which is beyond ridiculous.

EDIT: a recent patch has fixed this, will revisit review once I complete the game.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
The days of searching for "Spider-Man PC, Uncharted PC, Ghost of Tsushima PC, God of War PC" a million times are finally over.


It's time to bring Bloodborne™ DEMON SOULS .

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Crazy how I simply don't have to sign into the Playstation Network by simply not pressing the Sign Into Playstation Network button, and am able to play the game perfectly fine. You review bombers are embarrassing as hell.

Game is good, phenomenal actually.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
I find it hilarious that people are throwing tantrums and refunding the game over having to log in to playstation when there is literally an option to skip the login and you can play the entire game... without ever logging in... 

I am reminded every day how absolutely stupid some people are.

The game is great. And you can skip the PS login if you really don't want to do it. Problem solved.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: [b]"Not enough available memory" crash with a 24GB GPU and 64GB of RAM… guess Kratos needs even more godly hardware![/b]

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
This game requires a playstation network account to play and the support for reactivating such an account is spotty at best. 

Unfortunate because I loved its predecessor.

At the time of writing I am unable to access my PSN account due to a recent two factor identification update that I was not aware of and have no way to provide. After navigating to the Playstation website and was routed through the problem FAQ's to contact customer service. Customer service connected me with a chatbot, which then got stuck in a loop informing me that customer service was not available at this time, despite being within operating hours, which it also provided. 

After several more attempts and an apparent alignment of supernatural forces, I was able to convince the chatbot to place me in the queue to live chat with an agent. At time of writing my position was well over 100 from being able to chat. All this to recover an account for a service I do not want, to play a game that I have purchased through a separate service. 

This review will not change unless the PSN requirement is removed from the game.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: I get why people are upset about the PlayStation account stuff. It sucks when developers stuff online features into a single-player game. But I don't even understand because I could play fine without logging in.  It sucks because those reviews are gonna turn people away from an incredible game. I'm only an hour in and i'm already feeling the nostalgia of playing GOW 2018 for the first time. So please, take all those reviews with a grain of salt and play the game if you really want to. The world won't end if you sign into or make a PlayStation account. Just enjoy the game.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Same problem as others here! Unfortunately, I found that after about 1 hour of play, the buttery smooth 120 frames turned into lousy performance (30FPS). I don't think it's due to my setup. The graphics card is a 4070 Super. I noticed that after time, the VRAM utilization was at 150% instead of the initial 60%. 

The icons, subtitles and the entire UI also look unfinished!


Too bad, I was really looking forward to the game... Unfortunately, it's unplayable after an hour.

That's why I have to leave a bad rating for now! That should be better! :/

Edit: 
It is a known problem. It is not due to my hardware. It doesn't make any sense - then I should have 30fps throughout. I'm just sick of being a beta tester for a game I paid 80 euros for.

Here is a link to two discussions that deal with this topic:

Memory Leak:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/2322010/discussions/0/4843147950366339026/

UI / Icon problem:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/2322010/discussions/0/4843147760499953314/

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: incredibly frustrating to see the enforcement of a PSN account for a SINGLE PLAYER game. No matter how good the game is, you shouldn't be forced to do that.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: please add small subtitle size. default subtitle size is huge and looks bad. make font size smaller.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Gameplay and story awesome. State of the game now? Abysmal. Constant crashes, audio bugs, visual bugs, sudden ultra low FPS in the tree loading screen. If these things bug you, wait a few patches

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
requiring a psn account prevents playing on Linux or my steam deck.
the PlayStation runtime sdk wont load or install.
Edit:
using SteamDeck=1 %command% as a startup option will get it to run

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
i cant enter game because psn account. error : cant find server !!!!!!!! 
account for a single playe game what ??????

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Requiring a PSN account to play a PC game is stupid as fuck. I even tried to create an account, kept running into "connection to server timeout". Fuck you.

Edit: I finally was able to successfully create an account. For anyone receiving the "connection to server timed out" error when trying to create a login ID, try a different ID. I just added a couple numbers to mine and it went through, now I'm able to play the game. 

This review is staying negative tho until Sony gets their shit together.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: God of War Ragnarok could have been an unforgettable experience on PC, but the unnecessary and nonsensical PSN/Sony account requirements tarnish what should have been a flawless port, and breaks offline play on Steam Deck. Sony, if you're reading this, stop shackling amazing games with terrible DRM and account dependencies. Especially single player games! Let us enjoy the game we paid for without the extra hoops.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Thank you Sony and Santa Monica Studio for creating this game and bringing it to the pc. I love Kratos , it's by far my favourite game character and the God of war games makes you feel like a badass . I really hope that one day you will also bring the original trilogy to the pc. I finished this game already on my ps5 when it launched , but i'm mostly a pc player so having this in my collection is something that i really wanted. As for the pc port itself , the game runs very well , it's well optimised , i really don't mind the psn account as this was a playstation exclusive game . The story is great, the gameplay is amazing , there's plenty of secrets with a large area to explore . 10/10 game for me.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Okay I usually make reviews after 100%ing the game, but this time I can't help myself but give it now because I feel like most of the negative reviews are either due to the PSN accounts (which don't get me wrong, it does really suck but I don't think the game deserve the hate for something Sony does, it's not fair to the people that gave it hundreds of hours creating, they really did not make that stupid decision) and the other ones are because of optimization? I did not stumble upon any big issues regarding that, if I don't count one boat floating in the air lmao. I had chills playing this game from the first minute, I can't wait what's ahead of me and these negative reviews should not make you reconsider buying the game. Trust me, if you liked the first one, you will love the second one:) I do not regret paying 60 euros for such a gem. Now go have fun with it!!

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: was stoked to play, but the port is fucking me up, will wishlist and wait till they work out the performance bugs

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
If you are wondering about the current mixed reviews:
- positive reviews say game is gud!
- 80% negative reviews don't like the PSN account situation. 20% are having hardware issues.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: This game and the first are probably the best campaigns I have played in years. There are a few bugs and a few crashes that need to be fixed which tend to be annoying but worth it since I have waited two years for this game to come out. PSN login requirement is annoying but no biggie. Just create a login and rock on.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Death can have me, when it earns me.

Fate only binds you if you let it. Do what is necessary, not because it is written.

You must live with your deeds, but don't be troubled by them!

Kratos

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
- Requires online connection for a single player game
- Requires PSN Account
- (North, Central, and South America) Both PSN account and 3rd party game EULA enters you into a forced arbitration agreement from the date you purchase the game (not install) unless you send a physical letter to Sony's U.S HQ:
IF YOU ARE A UNITED STATES RESIDENT OR A RESIDENT OF A COUNTRY IN NORTH, CENTRAL OR SOUTH AMERICA, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, THIS AGREEMENT CONTAINS A BINDING INDIVIDUAL ARBITRATION AND CLASS ACTION WAIVER PROVISION IN SECTION 9 THAT AFFECTS YOUR RIGHTS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT AND WITH RESPECT TO ANY "DISPUTE" (AS DEFINED IN SECTION 9) BETWEEN YOU AND A SONY ENTITY (AS DEFINED IN SECTION 9)
....
IF YOU DO NOT WISH TO BE BOUND BY THE BINDING ARBITRATION AND CLASS ACTION WAIVER IN THIS SECTION 9, YOU MUST NOTIFY SIE IN WRITING WITHIN 30 DAYS OF THE DATE THAT YOU FIRST PURCHASE OR DOWNLOAD THE SOFTWARE (WHICHEVER IS EARLIER). YOUR WRITTEN NOTIFICATION MUST BE MAILED TO SONY INTERACTIVE ENTERTAINMENT LLC, 2207 BRIDGEPOINTE PARKWAY, SAN MATEO, CA 94404, UNITED STATES, ATTN: LEGAL DEPARTMENT - WAIVER, AND MUST INCLUDE: (1) YOUR NAME, (2) YOUR ADDRESS, (3) YOUR PLAYSTATION NETWORK SIGN-IN ID IF YOU HAVE ONE, AND (4) A CLEAR STATEMENT THAT YOU DO NOT WISH TO RESOLVE DISPUTES WITH SONY ENTITY THROUGH ARBITRATION.

The game also forces data collection: one of the first options is default set to "full data collection" and you can toggle between that and minimal collection, which, for a single player game, is not necessary. As though the $80 price is not enough for Sony.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Good job sony, if I hadn't bought the game from instant gaming, I would have asked for a refund. Giving my passport ID just to access one of your game is nonsense and it will not only tarnish your already piss poor reputation but also get you more people to never buy one of your game, even tho they're masterpiece.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Absolutely terrible on boarding process. Why do I need a sony account for a single player game?

I tried to create a sony account

sony account requires age verification, this steam account is old enough to buy its own beer! 

Age verification process is either uploading a copy of ID, having a facial scan, or receiving an SMS, I dont have a camera so am limited to SMS... which doesn't work, The SMS didn't come through... I close and open to start again, still nothing, then I hit a rate limit. Now the connection to the server times out. I literally can't play the game I bought. Its taking longer to sign up for an account I dont want than it took to download the game

Avoid purchasing this

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Not only that a Singleplayer game requires some third-party account, thats not enough, its not even working.
First wasnt able to create an account because "a connection to the server could not be established", after a bit that worked but now every time I try to log in I get into a "recover your account" loop, where I have to set a new password every time.
Fuck this shit, imma sail on the high seas

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Why the fck do I need a PSN account for a S I N G L E  P L A Y E R game?! I already payed full price.
This review will stay negative until Sony remove this BS

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
This is probably the best game behind Elden Ring to come out of 2022. I loved the first game and super keen to play this once I got it. There is a lot for me to say so if you’re looking for a shorter review the TDLR is: JUST GET IT AND PLAY IT. 

The story-telling in this game is top tier. I understand why it was contender for Game Of The Year. There were tons of emotional moments in this game, some even made me shed tears. Kratos, behind that stoic, tough exterior shows more emotion, makes him feel more human rather god. And Atreus still learning, growing but to finally make his own choices, to be a man. The cinematic cutscenes were just simply S tier. I loved the story of this game and how much it has built upon the previous. It is one of those games where it feels like a great movie and game all in one.  

Santa Monica Studios nailed the world-building of this game. They built upon the first game and often quote the events of the first game and the older games which deepens the overall lore significantly. I do not believe there is a single bad character in this game. They are all well written, well acted and they all interact with each other so well. Every character has well-written stakes in the conflict and that just makes the finale so much more impactful. 

The side quests are just amazing in this game, though not all of them but most of them. They add upon the world, the characters and their history with one another, and they have important dialogue and all of which just aided me to have a deeper connection to the characters and the world. Side quest bosses and the End-game bosses just add a fun challenge to the game as well. 

The combat is fun, its simple, easy to understand and satisfying. I loved creating my own combos in my head and seeing it pan out when I tried it. There is a diverse amount of special abilities to add to the weapons and there is no right answer to defeating the hardest bosses, you could just pick your poison and go at em. Moreover, the diverse range of builds with the armor, relics and gems only deepen the combat which is always great.

Most of the negatives I have of the game are just nit-picks. I did not enjoy the UI and the Map, I felt like the UI could have been simplified to make it easier to navigate. The map was just hard to use, it was difficult to see which is the right path to take and it barely zooms in to see any details. Lastly, Atreus combat was too easy, even on the harder difficulty which often led to the parts where you controlled him felt like they were dragging. 

Overall, I loved this game, it was difficult to put it down even after finishing the game to 100%. A definite recommend to buy.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
I was anticipating the launch of this game on steam, since I'm a fan of the GOW series and also loved the setting of the previous GOW game. At first I didn't care having to create a PSN account, since in my region it is available. Anyway as soon as I started the game and had to log in to said PSN account it kept infinitely looping between me having to sign in and the default screen where you can either continue to the sighn-in page or quit the game. Any actions in trying to repair the files and re-installing the game have unfortunately failed. The PSN support, if you can call it that has also failed to provide a feasible solution. Only stating that it should work after the file verification.

So I chose to refund this product which leaves me disappointed, since I was looking forward to playing this game. Guess if they didn't choose to implement that PSN requirement, just as they didn't in the previous GOW everything would've worked fine.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: PSN account is mandatory with no option to skip. Refunded and will only re-buy and update this review if Sony makes the account optional. When creating an account, age verification is required via a third party (Yoti) which requires either facial scan, ID or mobile number. There is no law in my country (Ireland) requiring age verification for videogames, so Sony has no excuse for making this mandatory. The game also installs Playstation PC SDK Runtime and does not uninstall it when uninstalling the game.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: good game but you have to sign in to playstation for absolutely no reason other because sony execs haven't learnt their lesson and want to show how incompetent and out of touch they are.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Good gameplay, good sountrack, good graphics. Could use some more UI settings, and is missing some audio calibration types and menu looks too much zoomed in. But overally good game.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Yeah i'm not linking my account to PSN especially for a single player game.

April 2011: Hackers Access Personal Data of 77 Million Sony PlayStation Network Users
May 2011: Personal Details on 25 Million Sony Online Entertainment Customers Stolen
June 2011: Sony Pictures Website Hacked, Exposing One Million Accounts
November 2014: Hackers Steal 100 Terabytes of Data from Sony Pictures
August 2017: Hacker Group Accesses Sony Social Media Accounts
September 2023: Sony Investigates Alleged Hack
October 2023: Sony Notifies Employees of Data Breach

There is NO reason a single player offline experience should require any third-party login—especially a PSN account on a PC platform. This provides no benefit to the customer and only worsens the overall experience, adding unnecessary security risks on top of being an inconvenience to the user and not even allowing people in certain countries to have access to it.

I enjoyed God of War 2018 and it didn't need this restriction, neither does this one. Consumers are complacent when it comes to companies degrading the user experience more and more in favour of their own interests and it will just get worse.

People don't complain enough about Triple A. 
A market that allows mediocrity will inevitably be filled with it.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Ragnarok is more of everything that was great in the 2018 release, combined with the epic scale of the original trilogy. 
The continuing story is outstanding, with thoroughly developed characters along with so much lore to chew on. Looks incredible and features once again brilliant, heartfelt voice acting (and mocap). Exceptionally well crafted environments and realms make exploration so fun, especially with the way they evolve throughout the story. 
Combat is as satisfying, brutal and rewarding as ever with some truly breathtaking boss fights. 
An undeniably superlative experience.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Requires a PSN account.

Would be harmless if it wasn't for the fact that it locks a bunch of folk in over a hundred countries out from even playing the game when it's completely unnecessary since it is a singleplayer game.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Issues so far:
-Mouse not working
-Does not detect my 5.1 setup (literally every other game including GOW 2018 detects it)
-Completely crashed my graphics output
-The PSN account creation works perfectly

Guys, learn from me and don't purchase this day one. Refunding the game and will probably pick for a sale if this shit is actually fixed. The only benefit of paying $60 nowadays is getting some beta testing experience on your resume.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Great game and you would be silly to miss out on that over needing to make a free account which you most likely already have

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Get rid of the crap sony network requirement so I can play the game I purchased. This is BS. I cannot recover my account because I don't have the email anymore and I am not making a new one! When you get rid of the account requirement. I will change my view of this game

Few More Words:
Its one of the best Sony IP you can play. the GOW 2018 is Epic and this is the continuation of that story. this is my 2nd Time Buying this game at full Price. One of the best Emotional and Story Driven game you can play in you entire life. the PC port is Solid Running ultra with 2k and 144 FPS on a 3080 . They ask you to Login to PS Network. but before starting the game they will ask you to accept sharing data you can skip that.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Kratos constantly tells Atreus about the importance of training, but in just a few years, he forgot all the skills and abilities that I improved with such difficulty in the first part...

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Sony and other companies need to learn that we are done with their crap. We want a game. Full effing stop. No lootbox BS, no pay to win, no stupid seasons, and definitely no bs totally unnecessary playstation accounts. We give you money, you give us a game, IT'S NOT THAT HARD TO UNDERSTAND.

This stays up until the PS Membership requirement goes away,.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Everything to do with God Of War Ragnarok is brilliant. Graphics and Sounds are brilliant perfect. 

Everything to do with Sony is terrible. Creating an essential PSN account is torture. Getting server timed out error messages caused by an insufficient Username. Technical issues with verifying account creation emails and account recovery issues. 

The PSN requirements are really hurting this amazing game. It was almost impossible to play a new game that I have paid for.

It's a No from me.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Was able to connect my PSN account in about 5 seconds. Now I never have to worry about it again.

Can't wait to to yell at Atreus again, it's been a while.

10/10

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
I've platinumed this game on PS5 already and 100% of the collectables already and highly recommend this game for the 10/10 story telling, an epic squeal to the reboot of 2018 GoW, and all around a fun hack and slash game that I love very much.

But this review is more about the morons on steam talking about how the game is bad because of the need of a PSN account because of "stealing data". My brother in Christ, if you've ever made an account for any online website/game you have already been a victim of it at some point. Don't base your review off of one point to try and boycott a game. Like cope harder bozo

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: I paid 50 dollars for this and i cant even play the game because i can't create an account. Thanks sony. You are the worst.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Unfortunately, Steam users tend to not be the smartest of the bunch and hop on the review bombing train despite 99% of the complaints being completely inaccurate. It's fine if you do not like the game, but please do not spread misinformation. I decided to purchase the game despite the complaints since I can always refund if I have problems. So far, my experience has been amazing. To clear misinformation, please see below:

1. Playstation Network Account is required.

This just isn't true. There is an option at the main menu to sign into the Playstation Network, but is completely optional. Select New Game to start. There is a notice on the Steam page which states a Playstation Network Account is required, not sure why, but it isn't. I have started my game without signing in.

2. Performance Issues.

I am a few hours in with 0 performance issues. I have a base 4070, 32GBs of DDR4, and a Ryzen 3900x. I play on Ultra at 1440p. I did upgrade to the latest drivers and allowed my shaders to compile before starting the game. I have noticed if you exit out of the game and jump back in later you will need to compile your shaders again. If you do not allow the shaders to compile, you will experience severe lag and stutters. It is VERY obvious your shaders are compiling because in the bottom right of your screen it shows the progress. I assume players with performance issues are allowing their shaders to compile, but based on all the reviews, it wouldn't surprise me if they just hop in the game without compiling, see the lag, quit out, and review bomb.

Hopefully this review helped with the misinformation.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
One of the best ports i played in years, ZERO stutter
RTX 4060Ti + i5-13400, 1440p (DLSS Balanced without Frame Gen - that is not working for nvidia) around 80~150 FPS (if the game is running 120fps, then 1% low is around 100 FPS)
and about the game story/gameplay we already know, it's VERY good

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
God of War Ragnarök is a one of a kind, unforgettable experience/journey. It is a direct sequel to 2018's Santa Monica's - God of War which won GOTY. I have played every single GOW game to 100% completion and the story of Kratos is unforgettable. From his origin to now, with his son Atreus, who also goes by the name of "Loki". 

I pre-ordered the collectors edition of GOW:R for my PS5 and, to this date, I do not regret a thing because this is what a story game (and collectors edition) should be like. 

Below I will tell you why GOW:R is an unforgettable experience and I will also share my thoughts and opinions on the game but before I get into anything, a quick disclaimer below!!

[b] This review is MY opinion, MY own personal experience and MY thoughts. I am brutally honest when it comes to reviewing games. If you do not like my opinion, my time or respect my personal experience, please move on. [/b] 

[h1][b] PSN REQUIRMENT/The only Con[/b][/h1] 
So I just want to start off by saying that the game does indeed require a PSN account to play the game which baffles me a little. Why does a SINGLE-PLAYER game require a THIRD-PARTY account to play on STEAM - the platform it is being launched on. 

Now, I do not mind to much personally because I own a PSN account but to the thousands of gamers/players out there that only use PC... Sony... you need to re-think this requirement because you are forcing players to make an account with your services to BOOST your "apparent" - players that own a PS console. 

Enough of this - now on to the review!!

[h1][b] Pros [/b][/h1] 
⚫The story is unforgettable. (no spoilers!!!)
⚫Not a single issue running the game at all. No freezing, stuttering, FPS drops... NOTHING. This is an unbelievable PC port. Bloodborne next?!?! Sony? Please?!!!
⚫The combat is so damn fluent just like 2018's GOW! Throwing your leviathan axe, turning it to ice for more damage, the catch for recalling it is just so smooth. The parrying is skillbased and very rewarding as you can punish your foes witth a slew of different combos and then you have your blocking which you can pull a full 180 turn to cover your rear in combat showing Kratos's Spartan reflexes.
⚫The boss fights... are just amazing. Figthing Thor, the god of thunder at tge start of the game was an absolute thrill ride to begin our epic journey across these realms. (only one I'm going to mention!!)
⚫Fighting giant mythological mini-boss's that are extremely punishing on GIVE ME GOD OF WAR difficulty and the vast array of enemies in the game will have you perfecting your combat prowess from start to finish. 
⚫The soundtrack is gorgeous!! I love it!
⚫Christopher Judge and Sunny Suljic really bring Kratos and Atreus to life and we all know the "BOY" statement by now! That's not all, Freya is voiced by the talented Danielle Bisutti and Thor who is voiced by Ryan Hurst (known for Sons of Anarchy or The Walking Dead's Omega).
⚫There is tonnes of lore, collectables and hidden little areas for you to explore! Remnants for one and Odins puzzles another. Not all collectables can be collected until you complete the game so you are in for a long journey!
⚫In any typical game you get side missions that are just downright boring and bland but in GOW:R they side quests REALLY standout as they add an unbelievable amount of character development behind them.
⚫The graphics are superb. Gorgeous even and picture-perfect-post-card worthy at times. 
⚫You can freely explore several different realms, if you have played 2018's GOW then you will know of Alfheim, which has been changed a little but for the better which makes it stand out amongst all the other realms! 
⚫The attention to detail is phenomenal. This is what you call a WORK OF ART. A LABOR OF LOVE. You can tell the people that worked on GOW:R have true love and passion about the game!!!
⚫The old armour customisation has now been streamlined and has been made very straightforward. Now you can take your favourite piece of equipment with you from start to end of the game!! 
⚫The puzzles are fun and new puzzles are introduced regularly which means you will not be doing the same thing over and over again for several hours till a new one comes into play.

[h1][b] My Verdict [/b][/h1] 
Phew... after all of that is said and done, I could go on and on and on in detail about each element of the game. Combat. Story. Graphics. Sound e.t.c but I cannot as Steam only allows a certain amount of words sadly but I think I have said enough for anyone looking to get into GOW:R!

So, would I recommend God of War Ragnarök. DAMN RIGHT I WOULD!!! This is what you call a "VIDEO-GAME" that is true to both it's origins and it's future! It is made with love and passion, clearly, and will forever me the highest standpoint for future games of it's kind!

[h1][b] 10/10 - GOTY worthy and undeniably unforgettable! A single-player game that blows away all others! [/b][/h1]

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
[h1]A giant, heartfelt blockbuster [/h1]

(Finished on PS5)

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3334439909

This is without a doubt one of the best games I have ever played.
[b]
+Excellent narrative and masterpiece one-shot camerawork that imaginatively retells Norse myths
+Excellent character development that adds intrigue to each exchange
+Combat that challenges you and gives you a sense of satisfaction and power
+Magnificent images with a remarkable scope
+Free dlc,unlocked frame rates,newest upscaling technology,super ultrawide support

-Finisher animations repeating 
-Too many quick time events
-Few bugs on PC platform,especially when climbing or rolling 

[h1]
Review Score: 100/100  🏆

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Downvote only for Sony and their stupid PSN requirement for an OFFLINE SINGLEPLAYER game. Before you even see the main menu, the game directly ask you about a PSN account and you have literally only two options:
1. Press A/Enter Agree to this stupid system and "log in to your PSN account" or
2. Press B/Return to exit the Game.
Are you serious?!

You pay 60€ for a game which doesn't want to be played unless you log into some stupid system for a console which i never had, so only the managers can show investors some higher numbers so they can stuff more money into their pockets.

Ok, after this rant: The game it self is awesome! 10/10 to the developers, who created this masterpiece!
Sound Design: A+
Gameplay: A+
World Design: A+
Art Design: A+
Camera: A+
and everything else: also A+
This game is actually one of the best games in 2024 (for PC).

If i can make a request to the developer Teams "Santa Monica Studio" and "Jetpack Interactive":
Please show Sony a MIddlefinger and leave this sh*t company!
So many PC players want to play your games and sony is ripping you off by "Sony exclusive" Deals. if you would build the game and release it at the same time on all platforms the same time you would make more money and your reputaion would not go down together with sony!
From my point i would love to buy a remastered/remake version of God of War 1-3 but not on sony sh*t consoles or system. give it to me on PC and i would be happy with each title for 60€!

for my last words i will only say this:
[b][u]FUCK YOU SONY![/u][/b]

Otherwise its a visually beautiful game so far. 


Decent game so far but I should not have to make a PSN game to enjoy a game I paid full price for.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:

Despite everything the Steam Page says, you are asked on boot to login but you can say "no" and play no problem. Went through the entire first hour without any issues. There is an option to login to PSN but as far as I can see this is completely optional.

With that out of the way from a PC port standpoint I have no notes great bevvy of options with support for all 3 major upscaling processes, full Ultrawide and multi monitor support, and runs like a dream on my machine (Ryzen 3600, RTX 3070 Ti) 4k no HDR DLSS on Performance.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
[h1]PSNo Account[/h1]
Requirement of a PSN account is complete crap, for a game released on Steam. GOW 2018 didn't have this requirement and was a wonderful port.

[h1]Low-Key Frames[/h1]
This one is quite laggy and even though I have a pc that matches the recommended requirements, lags are something that I cannot play with.

[h2]Winter (sale) is coming[/h2]
As good as this game is (seen only from Youtube), the lack of proper optimisation discourages buying imho. Wait until some sale, as will I after refunding.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
[h1]A Great Sequel, Held Back by Woke[/h1]

[h3]Introduction[/h3]

I played God of War: Ragnarök earlier this year on my PS5, spending over 90 hours to get the platinum for both the base game and the Valhalla DLC. You can check my stats and trophies here from the comments. After all those hours of gameplay, I can confidently say that Ragnarök delivers a great experience, though it has some issues that hold it back from being a masterpiece like its predecessor.

[h3]Not Just a DLC[/h3] 
 
One of the biggest criticisms people have thrown at Ragnarök is that it feels like a glorified DLC of the 2018 game, but I strongly disagree with that take. Sure, it has a similar design and gameplay structure, but that doesn’t make it a mere DLC. There’s more than enough new content, including new realms, characters, and abilities, to call it a full-fledged sequel. The combat, which was already excellent in God of War 2018, feels more refined. Plus, the new variety of enemies and more boss fights elevate the action to another level.

[h3]Expanded Gameplay and Content[/h3] 

The gameplay in Ragnarök is much more expanded compared to God of War 2018. There’s more variety in combat options, and the game offers deeper customization for your weapons, armor, and abilities, allowing players to tailor their playstyle in even more ways. Content-wise, the game also delivers far more to do, with a much richer world to explore. One major complaint about God of War 2018 was the repetitive enemy and boss fights. Thankfully, Ragnarök improves on this significantly. While there are still some repeated enemies and bosses, it happens far less often than in the previous game. One of the standout improvements in Ragnarök is the optional content. I've found them very fun to do and the same with hunting trophies once again, like the prequel. These side quests don’t feel like chores; they’re genuinely rewarding and worth doing. The post-launch Valhalla DLC is also a cool addition. While it’s much shorter than I expected and I wish there was more of it to sink into, but I can’t complain since it’s free.

[h3]The Woke Influence[/h3]

There’s an undeniable feeling that Ragnarök leans into a more woke tone. This isn’t just a personal opinion. There’s actual evidence that points to this. The developers worked with Sweet Baby Inc., a company known for inclusive storytelling, and that influence is noticeable throughout the game. Certain plotlines and character decisions feel forced, and at times, the story becomes nonsensical. While this may not bother some players, I found it detracted from the experience, making the narrative feel weaker. Replacing Cory Barlog as the main director was a huge mistake.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3210225946

[h3]Story and Narrative Issues[/h3] 

Now, let’s talk about one of the game’s major drawbacks: the narrative. The 2018 game told a tight, focused narrative centered on the relationship between Kratos and Atreus. In contrast, Ragnarök introduces a lot more characters and plotlines, which can sometimes feel overwhelming. Unfortunately, the game doesn’t spend enough time fully developing these new elements, and as a result, the story feels rushed in certain parts. Instead of the tight, emotional focus of the first game, Ragnarök tries to do too much and wraps up many plot points too quickly. Compared to the more compact, well-told story of God of War 2018, Ragnarök struggles to find the same emotional depth and coherence. This is a huge bummer since I was really hoping for a great story and narrative after the bar set by the predecessor. 

[h3]Graphics – A Missed Opportunity[/h3]  

Visually, Ragnarök is a step up from God of War 2018, but not by much. The graphics are definitely a little better, with sharper textures and improved lighting effects. However, I can't help but feel that the game’s visual potential was held back because it was also released for the PS4. If Ragnarök had been a PS5 exclusive, I think the graphics could have been way better and more impressive. By having to cater to last-gen hardware, the game wasn’t able to push the boundaries as far as it could have, which is a bit disappointing. Still, the game looked beautiful on the PS5 and I am sure it looks even better on PC.

[h3]Music – Less Memorable[/h3]  

Surprisingly, I didn’t enjoy Ragnarök’s soundtrack not even close to as I did the 2018 game's music. The composer, Bear McCreary, is the same for both, yet, the music in Ragnarök didn’t stick with me in the same way. That's because Ragnarök’s soundtrack mainly consists of redone versions of tracks from its predecessor, with not many new compositions that stand out. This lack of fresh and impactful new music made the soundtrack feel less original and less memorable. I still occasionally listen to God of War 2018’s soundtrack because it was so impactful, but I’ve never felt the urge to listen to Ragnarök’s music outside the game.

[h3]Expands, But Doesn’t Elevate[/h3]
  
Overall, I feel like there’s not much more to say about God of War Ragnarök. The game’s strengths are obvious, and they are mostly the same as in 2018. I’ve also mentioned the negatives, such as the woke elements and narrative problems. On top of that, the fact that it plays so safe and similarly to God of War 2018, is a negative for me. When a sequel feels too close to its predecessor, it loses some of its impact for me. Don't get me wrong -Ragnarök is a great game, and I highly recommend it- it just doesn’t feel like the groundbreaking game that God of War 2018 was for me.

[h1]GOLDEN MEDAL[/h1]

Follow My [URL=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40523765-Bearsonal/]Curator Page ⚜️[/URL]

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: Game is good. Sony can still go f*** themselves for requiring PSN, so this gets a thumbs down until they get their heads out of their ***holes.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Sorry for the countries that cannot make PSN accounts and there for can't play the game I fully feel for you. Those of you that can and are complaining whomp whomp it ain't that hard at least you can play the game. Steam deck users, not sure why but I didnt have to log into PSN via steam deck for some odd reason. Pressed play, got a black screen briefly and then the game loaded.

Now for people who want to know if this runs on the steam deck. I'm currently getting between 30-45 fps, low settings, AMD FSR 3.1 balanced , vsync off, fps limit off. Steam deck settings I've now locked the fps here as leaving it at 90fps I found it was a bit choppy. I've locked it to 36 fps and 1 hour in the game feels pretty damn smooth.

Edit: after playing further into the game when reaching svartalfheim there was a pretty big tank in performance on the steam deck. Upon entering svartalfheim I got roughly 25-30 fps some times dropping to 20 fps, however, after reaching the free roam area via boat the performance increased. I am actually able to play AMD FSR Quality between 30-45 fps I've now unlocked the refresh rate via steam deck settings and it is smoother than when I previously locked  it to 36fps. Also thank you for the clown awards, free points and I can play the game in peace knowing I didn't have to log into PSN network and cry about it.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
A Janky port from the PS5 version with some added perks for PC, it is currently unplayable due to crashing issues caused by movement through loading points and interactions with key story elements. These crashes keep the player from moving through the story. The game is entirely unplayable because of this issue. 

I'll flip this review to a recommend IF they resolve the issue.

EDIT. Refunded, what a joke.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Normally I don't leave a review until I've gotten way into the game or finished it. 

But tbh I'm getting really irritated by issues in the game so far. 
My biggest gripes are the following 3 so far after 14 hours of playing.

1) I keep getting this frozen camera issue where its not detecting the mouse movement in game. Everything else works but that. If I go into the menu you can see my mouse icon moving.. 
Have to keep changing camera settings and loading/reloading to eventually cause it to unfreeze.
But anytime I close the game and come back later, 9/10 this happens and takes a 6 or 7 reloads or fully restarts to get it working. Utter BS

2) Crashes, no issues with crashing but now I'm on the quest with Brok & Freya.. I get to two wolves, I kill the first and while I'm fighting the second it freezes and crashes. Literally cannot get past this now. 

3) The horrible exp of the Sloooooooooooow Atreus talking sections on his solo quests. The one with the young girl in the swamp just draaags on so long. Its like it was done on purpose just to add more 'game time' to the overall game. They def could have done that better to progress his storyline without it being such a tedious snore fest. 

Updating 22/9: 
4) Compiling Shader Cache
Logged in today and its compiling at a horrendously slow speed. 10 mins have passed and its at 50%. Logged out of the game and its still loading on the main screen at the same slow pace.

Sorry but Sony can keep their ports if they are going to charge full price for 2 year old games and them not be so buggy on launch. 
So as of right now I can't recommend this game with those issues alone and at this stage of play.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
I cant get past the first puzzle from Sony when attempting to create an account. All roads leads to "The connection to the server timed out."
If thats the entire game I cannot recommend it. Maybe when a DLC hits I will change my mind.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Update: After the patch 2, it no longer loads past the loading screen. Game just freezes after launch.

Update: by some chance I pushed past the title screen and played the prologue. Fixed at 144fps, on 1600p 38" ultrawide, at Ultra with DLSS + DLAA. Framegen was still broken (unable to select the setting without crashing).

Game has weird animation issues. Kratos almost teleports left and right when you rapidly alternate between a and d keys, as though he's missing animation frames. Sometimes the camera randomly cuts to an entirely new angle in an instant. Many icons (e.g. mouse prompts) also look pixelated and enlarged and like they are out of a 2000s game - as though they didn't buy the high-resolution version of an icon pack. The menu UI could use a lot more polish; it's very awkward to navigate.

When the game does work, it's a lot more of the first title - which is a good thing.

---

Can't recommend at this time. I would hold off until crash issues are resolved. I have sent no less than 8 crash reports in the last 10 minutes, and haven't even crossed the opening scene.
My specs are:
5800x3d
RTX 4090
32 GB 3600mhz RAM
MX500 SSD.

I won't refund because i do want to play this game, and i feel that they will fix such egregious issues sooner rather than later.

Very poor showing for launch, which is very unlike the recent ports such as Horizon and Tsushima.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: The game is amazing. Those that are whining about PSN, do not listen. You can choose to sign in to a PSN account, however, you are NOT forced to do so. Those troglodytes that say otherwise should be ignored. If you enjoyed GOW 4, you will enjoy this one!

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
A game that lets you watch Kratos crafting arrows for Atreus while "preparing shaders" does its thing for 4 mins has my instant respects and awe. I mean, how many games are build right from the start around incorporating necessity with experience? 

PS: I am an actual archer, who actually made his own arrows. And let me tell you, Kratos aka Sony developer did good in that regard, man :3

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
I'm still quite early in the game, and the game play seems fine. The graphics are good. The world is incredible. But I would caution against buying this game just yet. It has some technical issues.

The optimization, while frequently good, is also commonly inconsistent. There is an issue with camera drift when playing with controllers. I had to reinstall the game to fix an issue where the game would just go to a black screen when launched. 

It's a good game just like the previous game. But wait for some patches and driver updates from your GPU manufacturer.

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review: DLSS3 doesn't work, surround sound doesn't work, HDR setting doesn't save, performance degrade overtime. Runs noticably worse on nVidia cards than AMD even on a 4090. Charging premium price tag for a 2 years late product and can't even do proper QA, this is unacceptable in 2024. Next time give review code out early to tech outlet a couple weeks earlier so they can point out the flaws if you can't even bother to do your own QA. What a joke

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
-Worth buy...
-Yes
The game needs a day one patch. Visual problems with the interface and many people have mouse failures. I played on Dualsense and everything is fine. A 4070 video card with DLSS Balance can play at 4K 100fps on high/ultra settings. Overall the performance good
+
Returned Russian voice acting
Free DLC
Graphics better
No gameplay bugs
Good performance
-
Recommended Dualshock 4/Dualsense
Visual bugs in the interface
Need PSN account, no way without it.
Memory optimization, the game from 85gb increased to 175gb


PS: Спасибо за двухлетний бета тест! На этот раз справились отлично

title: God of War: Ragnarok
review:
Positive:
This Game Is amazing It runs smooth as Silk for me 170 FPS, Ultra Settings NVIDIA DLSS Set to Ultra Performance

Negative:
I cannot wrap my head around this, The PSN account link. Why put that In If you don't get anything back In return?

To The Negative Fans:
You don't need to have PSN Linkage to play the story mode I haven't linked mine and I've just beat Thor In Midgard so stop stressing
